title: Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Sideboard", February 24, 1937
medium: Graphite, black ink, blue and yellow color pencil on tracing paper
markings: Stamp in black ink, lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY
inscribed: Inscribed in stamp in graphite, lower right: 8561/F.S./ANDERSON, OLSSON/P.S./D./2/24/37, 3/3/37, 1, MASTERCR.; inscribed in graphite, above stamp: SIDEBOARD 6'-6" x 20"x36"H./TWO DOORS-/LEFT SIDE THREE SLIDING SHELVES/RIGHT SIDE TWO SLIDING SHELVES./DOOR PULLS: METAL SPINNINGS POL. CHROM./WITH WALNUT KNOB. FACE OF KNOBS WALNUT BURL/DOORS & DRAWER PULLS WALNUT BURL/THREE DRAWERS:/ON EXTENSION SLIDES/TOP DRAWER WITH TRAY & DIVIDERS/VELVET LINED. COLOR TO BE DICIDED/TOP- BASE & DRAWER FRONTS & EDGES - /MACASSAR EBONY - TO BE SELECTED/GRAIN VERTICAL/INTERIORS:/ BLEACHED WHITE SYCAMORE/VENEER ALL EXPOSED EDGES/TOP EDGES OF DRAWERS & DOORS; dimensions, materials, instructions in graphite
description: Perspective, plan, and elevation drawings for sideboard. Left and right side rounded and in walnut burl. Center, top, and base in macassar ebony. Cabinet doors at left and right with circular pulls. Three stacked drawers at center.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Harold S. Anderson House: Sideboard", February 24, 1937.
February 24, 1937. Graphite, black ink, blue and yellow color pencil on tracing paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-966.
